page.title: 19A Church in Kirk Sandall.
page.content: The{Emmanuel Congregational Church} started to be built in{May 1929.} There is a foundation stone laid by {Richard Austin Pilkington}on{May 8th. The official opening was not until November of that year. The church has two cloakrooms, a vestry and kitchen and two upstairs rooms as well as the main hall and stage. There are two organs, one in the hall and one in the vestry; also a piano. The Church is surrounded by large grounds which have been neglected over the years. Children can play in the grounds as well as the park next to it. Funds are raised by jumble sales and bazaars. In the church there is also a sunday school. The size of the congregation has altered over the years - it is now going down.
